bill_title: appropriate money for the expenses of the legislative, judicial, and executive departments of the state, certain officers, boards, and departments, for support and maintenance of the educational, charitable, and penal institutions, the South Dakota Veterans’ Home, for maintenance of the state capitol, and for support and maintenance of the state guard.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to appropriate money for the expenses of the legislative, judicial, and executive departments of the state, certain officers, boards, and departments, for support and maintenance of the educational, charitable, and penal institutions, the South Dakota Veterans' Home, for maintenance of the state capitol, and for support and maintenance of the state guard. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. There is hereby appropriated the following sums of money, or so much thereof as may be necessary, out of any money in the state treasury not otherwise appropriated, for the expenses of the legislative, judicial, and executive departments of the state, certain officers, boards, and departments, and for support and maintenance of the educational, charitable, and penal institutions, the South Dakota Veterans' Home, the state capitol, and the state guard for the fiscal year ending June 30, 2000. Section 26. The state treasurer is directed to transfer to the state general fund money from the following funds for the purpose herein indicated: Section 27. The state treasurer shall transfer to the state general fund twelve million dollars ($12,000,000) from the cement plant fund. Section 28. The special committee created by chapter 4-8A may, upon recommendation of the Governor and a majority vote of all members of the special committee, establish the maximum salary or per diem compensation and allowable expenses that may be paid to members of state boards, councils, commissions, and advisory bodies created by law during the Seventy-fourth Legislative Session or created by an executive order of the Governor for purposes of setting policy.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to appropriate money for the expenses of the legislative, judicial, and executive departments of the state, certain officers, boards, and departments, for support and maintenance of the educational, charitable, and penal institutions, the South Dakota Veterans' Home, for maintenance of the state capitol, and for support and maintenance of the state guard. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. There is hereby appropriated the following sums of money, or so much thereof as may be necessary, out of any money in the state treasury not otherwise appropriated, for the expenses of the legislative, judicial, and executive departments of the state, certain officers, boards, and departments, and for support and maintenance of the educational, charitable, and penal institutions, the South Dakota Veterans' Home, the state capitol, and the state guard for the fiscal year ending June 30, 2000. Section 26. The state treasurer is directed to transfer to the state general fund money from the following funds for the purpose herein indicated: Section 27. The state treasurer shall transfer to the state general fund twelve million dollars ($12,000,000) from the cement plant fund. Section 28. The special committee created by chapter 4-8A may, upon recommendation of the Governor and a majority vote of all members of the special committee, establish the maximum salary or per diem compensation and allowable expenses that may be paid to members of state boards, councils, commissions, and advisory bodies created by law during the Seventy-fourth Legislative Session or created by an executive order of the Governor for purposes of setting policy. Section 29. The state treasurer shall transfer to the state general fund one hundred forty thousand dollars ($140,000) from the coordinated soil and water conservation fund. Section 30. Two FTE in the Governor's Office of Economic Development shall be marketing specialists and shall coordinate with the Department of Agriculture on value added agriculture projects. Section 31. General Fund Operating Expenses for the program "Administration, Secretary of Education & Cultural Affairs" include $139,500 to contract with South Dakota Public Broadcasting to produce, acquire, and distribute educational programs and outreach materials for early childhood learning. Section 32. Money appropriated in this Act for support of Black Hills Forest High School is in lieu of ADM support via state aid to education. Section 33. The secretary of state shall conduct a survey for Amendment E using any general funds appropriated in the secretary of state's budget. Section 34. The Legislature hereby recognizes $37,329,294 of the other fund expenditure authority in this Act as continuously appropriated to the Board of Regents. This expenditure authority is solely for expenditure of tuition and fees revenue, and may not be used to expend other funds for which there is not otherwise appropriated sufficient expenditure authority. BILL HISTORY 1/26/99 First read in House and referred to Appropriations. H.J. 194 2/17/99 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/17/99 Appropriations Deferred to another day. 2/18/99 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 3/2/99 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 3/3/99 Appropriations Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 9, NAYS 0. 3/3/99 Appropriations Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 10, NAYS 0. H.J. 883

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to appropriate money for the expenses of the legislative, judicial, and executive departments of the state, certain officers, boards, and departments, for support and maintenance of the educational, charitable, and penal institutions, the South Dakota Veterans' Home, for maintenance of the state capitol, and for support and maintenance of the state guard. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. There is hereby appropriated the following sums of money, or so much thereof as may be necessary, out of any money in the state treasury not otherwise appropriated, for the expenses of the legislative, judicial, and executive departments of the state, certain officers, boards, and departments, and for support and maintenance of the educational, charitable, and penal institutions, the South Dakota Veterans' Home, the state capitol, and the state guard for the fiscal year ending June 30, 2000. Section 26. The state treasurer is directed to transfer to the state general fund money from the following funds for the purpose herein indicated: Section 27. The state treasurer shall transfer to the state general fund twelve million dollars ($12,000,000) from the cement plant fund. Section 28. The special committee created by chapter 4-8A may, upon recommendation of the Governor and a majority vote of all members of the special committee, establish the maximum salary or per diem compensation and allowable expenses that may be paid to members of state boards, councils, commissions, and advisory bodies created by law during the Seventy-fourth Legislative Session or created by an executive order of the Governor for purposes of setting policy. Section 29. The state treasurer shall transfer to the state general fund one hundred forty thousand dollars ($140,000) from the coordinated soil and water conservation fund. Section 30. Two FTE in the Governor's Office of Economic Development shall be marketing specialists and shall coordinate with the Department of Agriculture on value added agriculture projects. Section 31. General Fund Operating Expenses for the program "Administration, Secretary of Education & Cultural Affairs" include $139,500 to contract with South Dakota Public Broadcasting to produce, acquire, and distribute educational programs and outreach materials for early childhood learning. Section 32. Money appropriated in this Act for support of Black Hills Forest High School is in lieu of ADM support via state aid to education. Section 33. The secretary of state shall conduct a survey for Amendment E using any general funds appropriated in the secretary of state's budget. Section 34. The Legislature hereby recognizes $37,329,294 of the other fund expenditure authority in this Act as continuously appropriated to the Board of Regents. This expenditure authority is solely for expenditure of tuition and fees revenue, and may not be used to expend other funds for which there is not otherwise appropriated sufficient expenditure authority. Section 35. In the Division of Development Disabilities within the Department of Human Services, $237,300 of the appropriation shall be used for the purpose of increasing the wage exclusion for community based services clients from $200 to $400 per month. BILL HISTORY 1/26/99 First read in House and referred to Appropriations. H.J. 194 2/17/99 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/17/99 Appropriations Deferred to another day. 2/18/99 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 3/2/99 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 3/3/99 Appropriations Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 9, NAYS 0. 3/3/99 Appropriations Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 10, NAYS 0. H.J. 883
